language.label: Language
common.submissionLocked: Submission locked until required fields, images, certifications, partner review, and approval are complete.
phase.disabled.title: Supplier Phase Disabled

nav.title: Supplier
guard.forbidden.title: Access restricted

dashboard.title: Supplier Dashboard
dashboard.subtitle: Orders, compliance status, promotions, and required actions.
dashboard.card.onboarding: KYB status, authorised reps, payout readiness.
dashboard.card.orders: Open orders, shipment milestones, SLA warnings.
onboarding.modal.title: Welcome to the RedRooEnergy Supplier Dashboard
onboarding.modal.subtitle: This onboarding notice is mandatory and binding. Please read carefully before proceeding.
onboarding.welcome.p1: Welcome to the RedRooEnergy (RRE) Marketplace. This dashboard is your controlled operational workspace for supplying products into the Australian clean-energy market through RRE. It is not a generic e-commerce portal. It is a governed, compliance-led marketplace designed to protect buyers, suppliers, regulators, and long-term market trust.
onboarding.welcome.p2: RRE exists to connect approved global manufacturers and suppliers with Australian residential, commercial, and project buyers—while ensuring full regulatory compliance, transparent pricing, and Delivered Duty Paid (DDP) logistics.
onboarding.welcome.bullets.title: RRE ensures:
onboarding.welcome.bullet1: Products fully compliant with Australian regulations
onboarding.welcome.bullet4: Clear allocation of risk and responsibility
onboarding.who.title: Who We Are and How RRE Operates
onboarding.who.p1: RedRooEnergy is a compliance-first marketplace operator, not a reseller and not a commission broker. We operate on the following principles:
onboarding.who.bullet1: Products must be verified, certified, and auditable.
onboarding.who.bullet2: Buyers must receive compliant products delivered DDP.
onboarding.who.bullet3: Suppliers must operate under clear rules with no hidden fees.
onboarding.who.bullet4: Trust is built through process, not promises.
onboarding.who.p2: RRE does not allow unverified products, self-certification shortcuts, or silent changes after approval.
onboarding.flow.title: How the RRE Marketplace Works (At a High Level)
onboarding.flow.step1: You submit products through this dashboard using a structured product intake system.
onboarding.flow.step2: Products are independently reviewed by approved compliance and certification partners.
onboarding.flow.step3: RRE Admin performs a final governance and marketplace approval.
onboarding.flow.step4: Approved products are published into the RRE catalogue.
onboarding.flow.step5: Buyers place orders; funds are held securely.
onboarding.flow.step6: Products are shipped Delivered Duty Paid (DDP) into Australia.
onboarding.flow.step7: Payments are released according to delivery and compliance milestones.
onboarding.flow.p1: Every step is logged, auditable, and transparent.
onboarding.dashboard.title: Your Supplier Dashboard – What This Is and What It Is Not
onboarding.dashboard.is.bullet1: Your only authorised channel to list products on RRE.
onboarding.dashboard.is.bullet2: A governed system with clear stages and approvals.
onboarding.dashboard.is.bullet3: A long-term operational platform, not a one-time upload tool.
onboarding.dashboard.not.bullet3: A bypass around Australian compliance rules.
onboarding.upload.title: How to Upload and Submit Products Successfully
onboarding.upload.step1.title: Step 1: Create a New Product (Draft)
onboarding.upload.step1.body: In the New Products (Drafts) section, select Create New Product. You will first be required to select the product category. This step is mandatory and determines: the technical specifications required, the certifications that apply (CEC, RCM, GEMS), and the documents that must be provided. You cannot proceed without selecting the correct category.
onboarding.upload.step2.title: Step 2: Complete the Product Specification Form
onboarding.upload.step2.body: Once the category is selected, the system will display all required fields for that product type, including technical specifications, electrical and mechanical details, performance ratings, and packaging and logistics data. All fields are validated. Incomplete or inconsistent data will block submission.
onboarding.upload.step3.title: Step 3: Upload Product Images (Mandatory)
onboarding.upload.step3.body: Each product must include exactly six (6) high-quality product images, including clear product views and a visible product nameplate or label. Poor-quality or misleading images will result in rejection.
onboarding.upload.step4.title: Step 4: Upload Certifications and Compliance Documents
onboarding.upload.step4.body: Based on the product category, you will be required to upload relevant certifications, such as CEC listings, RCM / EESS evidence, and GEMS registrations (where applicable). All documents must be PDF, accurate, current, and match the submitted product model exactly.
onboarding.partner.title: Compliance & Certification Service Partners (Mandatory)
onboarding.partner.body: Before your product can be submitted to RRE Admin, you must select an approved Compliance & Certification Service Partner. These partners are independent specialists who review your product documentation, verify certification accuracy, and confirm compliance suitability for the Australian market. Only products that pass partner review can proceed.
onboarding.approval.title: Supplier Internal Approval (Your Responsibility)
onboarding.approval.body: Before submission, an authorised representative of your organisation must approve the product internally. This step confirms that the information provided is accurate, the certifications are genuine, and you accept responsibility for the submission. This approval is logged and cannot be bypassed.
onboarding.admin.title: RRE Admin Approval – Final Marketplace Gate
onboarding.admin.body: After partner approval, the product is submitted to RRE Admin. Admin review includes governance checks, documentation completeness, marketplace suitability, and risk and compliance review. Admin may approve or reject the product. Rejections always include reasons and guidance.
onboarding.pricing.title: Pricing, Payments, and Fees (Important)
onboarding.pricing.nocommission.title: No Commission Model
onboarding.pricing.nocommission.body: RRE does not charge supplier commissions on sales. Suppliers set their product prices within RRE pricing rules, do not pay percentage commissions on orders, and are paid through secure, milestone-based settlement. This ensures predictable margins and transparent buyer pricing.
onboarding.pricing.ddp.title: Freight, Duty & DDP (Delivered Duty Paid)
onboarding.pricing.ddp.body: All physical product shipments on RRE operate under Delivered Duty Paid (DDP). Customs clearance is handled, duties and GST are calculated, buyers receive landed pricing clarity, and logistics are fully documented. You will be required to provide accurate packaging, HS codes, and shipment details.
onboarding.marketing.title: Marketing, Promotions, and Visibility Opportunities
onboarding.marketing.body: RRE provides structured, governed marketing opportunities for suppliers: Featured Deals, Supplier Hot Deals, Weekly Best Deals, and curated catalogues. All promotions are rule-based, time-locked, auditable, and subject to approval.
onboarding.after.title: What Happens After Approval
onboarding.after.body: Once approved, products appear in buyer searches and catalogues, you can participate in promotions, orders can be placed, compliance and expiry monitoring continues, and any product changes require a new revision submission. Approved products cannot be silently edited.
onboarding.success.title: How to Succeed on RRE
onboarding.success.body: Suppliers who succeed on RRE submit complete, accurate products the first time, work proactively with certification partners, maintain current certificates, provide clear images and documentation, respond quickly to review questions, and respect the governed process. Shortcuts cause delays or rejection.
onboarding.final.title: Final Notes
onboarding.final.body: RRE is designed for serious, long-term suppliers who value market access, regulatory certainty, predictable operations, and buyer trust. If you follow the process in this dashboard carefully, you will be able to list products efficiently and scale your presence in the Australian clean-energy market with confidence.
onboarding.legal.footnote: In case of inconsistency, the English version prevails.
onboarding.acknowledge: I acknowledge that I have read and understood the Supplier Dashboard onboarding requirements and agree to operate within the governed process described above.

products.drafts.helper: Draft products are private until submitted. Complete required fields before submission.

legal.footnote: In case of inconsistency, the English version prevails.
documents.title: Documents & Evidence
documents.subtitle: Immutable records of invoices, packing lists, certificates, and delivery evidence linked to your products and orders.
documents.overview.title: Overview
documents.overview.body: This vault is the supplier’s authoritative record of documents that support compliance, fulfilment, and audit readiness. Files stored here are immutable and time-stamped at the point of capture.
documents.includes.title: What appears here
documents.includes.item1: Certificates and test reports linked to product approvals.
documents.includes.item2: Commercial invoices, packing lists, and shipping documentation.
documents.includes.item4: Partner review reports and audit references.
documents.governance.title: Governance rules
documents.governance.item1: Documents are append-only and cannot be overwritten or deleted.
documents.governance.item2: Each file is versioned, hashed, and linked to a specific product or order.
documents.governance.item3: Only role-scoped documents are visible to suppliers.
documents.applies.title: How this applies
documents.applies.body: When product reviews, shipments, or disputes are audited, this vault provides the evidence trail used by RedRooEnergy and external regulators. Accuracy and completeness here protect suppliers from downstream ambiguity.
commercial.title: Commercial / Negotiated Orders
commercial.subtitle: Managed negotiation flow for large or non-standard orders with locked quotes and governed approvals.
commercial.overview.title: Overview
commercial.overview.body: This dashboard supports governed, high-value transactions that require structured approvals. It replaces instant checkout with negotiated, audit-ready workflows.
commercial.workflow.title: Workflow
commercial.workflow.step1: Buyer submits a negotiated order request with scope and volume requirements.
commercial.workflow.step2: Supplier prepares a quote and uploads supporting documentation.
commercial.workflow.step3: RedRooEnergy applies governance checks and approvals.
commercial.workflow.step4: Pricing is locked and commercial invoices are issued.
commercial.governance.title: Governance rules
commercial.governance.item1: Quotes cannot be edited once submitted without a formal revision request.
commercial.governance.item2: Negotiated pricing is snapshot-locked and auditable.
commercial.governance.item3: All approvals and changes are logged with timestamps.
commercial.applies.title: How this applies
commercial.applies.body: Use this area for enterprise, government, or large-scale procurement where buyers require fixed terms, staged delivery, or compliance gating before purchase.
risk.title: Risk & Audit (Read-Only)
risk.subtitle: Supplier-scoped audit logs, compliance flags, and governance notices. Read-only by design.
risk.readonly: Audit data is read-only and governed.
risk.overview.title: Overview
risk.overview.body: This view provides transparency into governance outcomes and audit trails without permitting any edits or overrides. It is designed for internal supplier compliance teams and regulatory readiness.
risk.records.title: What is recorded
risk.records.item1: Product lifecycle events and approval decisions.
risk.records.item2: Certification uploads, partner review outcomes, and timestamps.
risk.governance.title: Governance rules
risk.governance.item1: No record can be edited, deleted, or suppressed.
risk.governance.item2: Every event is traceable to a user or system actor.
risk.governance.item3: Audit evidence is presented exactly as stored at the time of capture.
risk.applies.title: How this applies
risk.applies.body: Supplier operations should use this view to validate compliance posture, confirm audit readiness, and respond to governance notices in a timely, documented manner.
security.title: Account Security
security.subtitle: Multi-factor authentication, session history, and role-based access controls for supplier accounts.
security.overview.title: Overview
security.overview.body: Supplier accounts must maintain strong access controls to protect product data, pricing, and compliance evidence. This section surfaces security status and access governance.
security.controls.title: Controls enforced
security.controls.item1: MFA status for all supplier users.
security.controls.item2: Session and device history with timestamped access logs.
security.governance.title: Governance rules
security.governance.item1: Access changes are logged and require authorised approval.
security.governance.item2: Failed access attempts are recorded for audit review.
support.title: Support & Help
support.subtitle: Supplier guides, governance references, and structured support channels for marketplace operations.
support.overview.title: Overview
support.overview.body: This section provides supplier-specific guidance, operational checklists, and policy references to help maintain compliance and reduce order delays.
support.coverage.title: Support coverage
support.coverage.item2: Order fulfilment steps and evidence requirements.
support.coverage.item3: Shipping, DDP, and customs documentation guidance.
support.governance.title: Governance rules
support.governance.item1: Support interactions are logged for audit traceability.
support.governance.item2: Policy-related requests must follow documented workflows.
support.governance.item3: All guidance aligns with the current governance framework.
legal.title: Legal & Policies
legal.subtitle: Supplier agreements, governance policies, and required acknowledgements for operating on RedRooEnergy.
legal.overview.title: Overview
legal.overview.body: This area consolidates the contractual terms, compliance obligations, and governance rules that apply to suppliers operating on the marketplace.
legal.documents.title: Key documents
legal.documents.item1: Supplier agreement and marketplace participation terms.
legal.documents.item4: Change control and product revision policies.
legal.ack.title: Acknowledgements
legal.ack.body: Suppliers must acknowledge updates to policies before submitting new products or receiving payouts. Each acknowledgement is time-stamped and retained for audit review.
analytics.title: Analytics & Performance
analytics.subtitle: Sales, conversion, SLA adherence, and promotion performance.
analytics.recent.title: Recent orders
analytics.order.label: Order {id}
onboarding.page.title: Supplier Onboarding
onboarding.page.subtitle: Provide KYB, payout, and payment capability details. Full prepayment is required unless an approved waiver exists.
onboarding.page.section.kyb.title: KYB & Beneficiary
onboarding.page.section.payment.title: Payment Rails & Currencies
onboarding.page.section.prepayment.title: Prepayment Acknowledgement
onboarding.page.section.prepayment.note: Default is full prepayment. Staged payments are forbidden without recorded approvalId per governance 04.07/04.09.
onboarding.page.error.kyb: KYB legal name and beneficiary name are required.
onboarding.page.error.rail: Select at least one payment rail.
onboarding.page.error.approval: Full prepayment off requires approval ID.

shipments.readonly: Shipment milestones are managed by authorised admin and freight partners. This view is read-only for your role.
shipments.forbidden: Forbidden: skipping milestones, marking delivered without evidence, editing milestones post-settlement (not available in supplier UI).

payments.readonly: Payment status is read-only. Escrow releases and refunds are controlled by governance.

payments.ledger.disclaimer: Fees are recorded at marketplace level only. RRE does not process service payments.

returns.section.disputes.title: Disputes

messages.system.title: System alerts
messages.footer: Supplier-to-buyer messaging will appear here when enabled. All communications are logged and governed.

payout.subtitle: Governance gates before settlement can be requested.
payout.gate.kyb.label: KYB verified
payout.gate.kyb.note: Supplier KYB must be verified before payout.
payout.gate.beneficiary.label: Beneficiary matches KYB
payout.gate.beneficiary.note: Beneficiary name must match KYB entity.
payout.gate.aud.label: AUD payout supported
payout.gate.rails.label: Payment rails declared
payout.gate.rails.note: At least one approved rail required.
payout.gate.disputes.label: No active disputes/returns/warranties impacting payout
payout.gate.disputes.note: Placeholder until disputes/returns surfaced in supplier view; treat as pass for now.
payout.gate.delivery.label: Delivered + return window passed for eligible items
payout.gate.delivery.note: Settlement requires delivery and return window expiry.
payout.gate.evidence.label: Delivery evidence present
payout.ready: Ready for settlement request (subject to admin review).
payout.blocked: Payout readiness blocked. Resolve the red items above before requesting settlement.
payout.forbidden: Forbidden: requesting payout with failed gates; bypassing governance without admin approval ID; exposing payment secrets or rails outside approved list.

onboarding.i18n.title: Bilingual (English / Chinese) Support — Supplier Dashboard
onboarding.i18n.body:
Bilingual (English / Chinese) support across all Supplier Dashboard pages in the RedRooEnergy (RRE) Marketplace. This is written as a developer directive, not a discussion. CODEX DIRECTIVE Feature: Bilingual Supplier Dashboard (English / Chinese) Scope: All supplier-facing pages, components, forms, help text, onboarding content, validation messages, and system notices Languages: * English (en) – default * Simplified Chinese (zh-CN) 1. CORE REQUIREMENTS (NON-NEGOTIABLE) 1. Every supplier page must support English and Chinese. 2. Language selection must be user-controlled. 3. Language preference must be persisted per supplier user. 4. No hard-coded English strings are permitted in supplier UI. 5. Language switching must not reload or reset form state. 6. English remains the authoritative legal language where required, but Chinese must be fully readable everywhere. 2. LANGUAGE SWITCH UI (SUPPLIER DASHBOARD) Placement * Top-right of Supplier Dashboard header * Visible on all supplier pages UI Control * Toggle or dropdown with: * EN (English) * 中文 (简体中文) Behaviour * Switching language: * Updates all visible text immediately * Does NOT reload the page * Does NOT clear form inputs * Selected language: * Saved to user profile * Restored automatically on next login 3. TECHNICAL APPROACH (REQUIRED PATTERN) A. Centralised i18n System Codex must implement a key-based internationalisation system, for example: * i18n / next-intl / equivalent * No inline literals in JSX/TSX Pattern: * Every UI string → translation key * Keys are stable and human-readable * Text is loaded from language dictionaries 4. TRANSLATION FILE STRUCTURE (MANDATORY) Codex must create language resource files as follows: /locales/ /en/ supplier.json /zh-CN/ supplier.json All supplier-related text lives in these files only. 5. TRANSLATION KEY DESIGN (EXAMPLE) Example Keys (supplier.json) { "dashboard.welcome.title": "Welcome to the RedRooEnergy Supplier Dashboard", "dashboard.welcome.subtitle": "Your governed workspace for compliant product submission and sales", "products.tabs.all": "Product Catalogue", "products.tabs.drafts": "New Products (Drafts)", "products.tabs.review": "Products Under Review", "products.tabs.approved": "Approved Products", "products.tabs.rejected": "Rejected / Suspended Products", "product.create.button": "Create New Product", "product.category.select": "Select Product Category", "product.images.title": "Product Images", "product.images.requirement": "Exactly six (6) clear product images are required", "approval.supplier.title": "Supplier Internal Approval", "approval.supplier.button": "Approve Product for Submission", "partner.select.title": "Select Compliance & Certification Partner", "partner.review.status.pending": "Partner review pending", "partner.review.status.pass": "Partner review passed", "partner.review.status.fail": "Partner review failed" } Chinese Version (zh-CN/supplier.json) { "dashboard.welcome.title": "欢迎使用 RedRooEnergy 供应商仪表板", "dashboard.welcome.subtitle": "用于合规产品提交与销售的受监管工作平台", "products.tabs.all": "产品目录", "products.tabs.drafts": "新产品（草稿）", "products.tabs.review": "审核中的产品", "products.tabs.approved": "已批准产品", "products.tabs.rejected": "已拒绝 / 已暂停产品", "product.create.button": "创建新产品", "product.category.select": "选择产品类别", "product.images.title": "产品图片", "product.images.requirement": "必须上传且仅能上传 6 张清晰的产品图片", "approval.supplier.title": "供应商内部审批", "approval.supplier.button": "批准产品提交", "partner.select.title": "选择合规与认证服务合作伙伴", "partner.review.status.pending": "合作伙伴审核中", "partner.review.status.pass": "合作伙伴审核通过", "partner.review.status.fail": "合作伙伴审核未通过" } 6. COMPONENT IMPLEMENTATION RULES A. Usage in Components Codex must ensure all supplier components follow this pattern: import { useTranslations } from "next-intl"; const SupplierProductsPage = () => { const t = useTranslations("supplier"); return ( <>

{t("dashboard.welcome.title")}

{t("dashboard.welcome.subtitle")}

); }; Rules: * No raw strings * No inline Chinese or English * Everything goes through t("key") 7. FORMS, VALIDATION & ERROR MESSAGES Codex must ensure: * All field labels are translated * All placeholders are translated * All validation messages are translated * All blocking/error messages are translated Example: "validation.images.count": "Exactly six product images are required" Chinese: "validation.images.count": "必须上传且仅能上传 6 张产品图片" 8. LEGAL & GOVERNANCE TEXT HANDLING Rules: 1. English text remains the authoritative legal reference 2. Chinese text is informational but complete 3. Where required, add a small footnote: English: “In case of inconsistency, the English version prevails.” Chinese: “如中英文内容存在差异，以英文版本为准。” This footnote must itself be translatable. 9. DATA VS UI LANGUAGE (IMPORTANT) Codex must not translate stored data, only UI text. * Product names → supplier input (original language) * Certificates → original language * Uploaded documents → unchanged * Database values → language-neutral Only labels, instructions, and system text are translated. 10. PERSISTENCE OF LANGUAGE PREFERENCE Codex must implement: * preferredLanguage field on Supplier User profile * Values: en | zh-CN * On login: * Load preference * Initialise i18n context * On switch: * Update preference immediately * Persist via API 11. TESTING REQUIREMENTS (MANDATORY) Codex must include tests to verify: * All supplier pages render correctly in both languages * No missing translation keys * No fallback to English when zh-CN is selected * Language switching does not reset Draft forms * Partner workflow, approvals, errors all display bilingual text 12. GOVERNANCE RULE (FINAL) Any future supplier page, feature, or component: * Must include both English and Chinese text * Must not ship without translations * Must fail CI if untranslated keys are detected
onboarding.redirect.title: Supplier Onboarding Moved
onboarding.redirect.body: Supplier onboarding is now combined into the Company Profile. Use the Company Profile page to complete identity and onboarding requirements.
